choices: To raise money, the government asked the women to support the centre and they did that by holding car washes and also raised money from libraries, schools and courts.
Women against violence against women movement people raised funds by holding car washes, went to libraries, schools and courts to spread their message and also worked with rape survivors.
Women against violence against women movement supported the center when it ran out of money to support schools, libraries and courts. They also supported police stations and hospitals.

To raise money to support their campaign the women against violence against women movement protested against the government and took their campaign to schools, courts, libraries, police stations and hospitals.

text: In the women against violence against women movement I took to the streets to take back a night. I went back to government to agitate for funding when the center was running out of money and when that didnâ€™t work we held car washes to raise money for the center. We went to local libraries, to schools, to courts to advocate for and support our clients. We spoke about violence against women. we went to police stations and hospitals but most importantly we worked with rape survivors.
